data.title: Adobe Inc. - statistics & facts
data.meta_description: Find the most up-to-date statistics and facts on U.S software company, Adobe Inc.
data.text:
Adobe Inc., the software giant behind the ubiquitous PDF and the iconic Photoshop and Lightroom, is not just riding the wave of generative AI (genAI) — it's shaping it. The company's three core segments, Digital Media, Digital Experience, and Publishing and Advertising, are each undergoing a profound transformation, harnessing the power of genAI to redefine creativity, customer experience, and digital engagement. From artists and designers to marketers and businesses, Adobe's innovative suite of solutions is pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the digital realm.

Step into the cloud

Adobe’s strategic shift to a cloud-based subscription model has fueled remarkable financial success, exceeding 19 billion U.S. dollars in revenue in 2023. This transition has propelled its flagship products like creative cloud's (featuring Photoshop and illustrator), which formed the largest portion of the company's revenue, and document cloud (including Acrobat) to new heights. Simultaneously, Adobes acquisition of Omniture, a leading web analytics and online marketing firm, has strengthened its foothold in the digital marketing arena, with Adobe experience cloud emerging as a major player, contributing to over 20 percent of the revenue.

GenAI powered by cloud

Adobe's unwavering commitment to innovation coupled with its strategic embrace of genAI and cloud-based solutions positions it as a dominant force in the ever-evolving digital landscape. The recent release of Firefly, a suite of creative artificial intelligence models integrated into popular Adobe products, empowers users to generate images and other creative assets through prompts. Additionally, Adobe Sensei, a GenAI service, is being integrated to Adobe Experience cloud, enhancing marketing workflows and personalized content creation.

The integration of genAI into the Adobe ecosystem is revolutionizing workflows, enhancing customer experiences and breathing new life into legacy products. By continually reimagining its product offerings and expanding its market reach, Adobe is poised for continued growth and success in the years to come.
